intro: Lesquerella arctica var. minor, commonly known as Arctic lesquerella, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Arctic tundra. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its small, green, succulent leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces seed pods that contain oil-rich seeds, which are used in various industrial applications. It thrives in cold, nutrient-poor soils and is adapted to withstand harsh Arctic conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species for studying plant adaptations to extreme environments.
